{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents discuss various types of colonic polyps, including neoplastic polyps which have malignant potential. Tubular adenomas are the most common type of neoplastic polyp and have a low malignant potential. Since the excisional biopsy shows 75% tubular architecture, it is likely that the polyp is an adenomatous polyp. Asymptomatic patients with positive fecal occult blood tests may have synchronous or metachronous polyps, which increases their risk of developing colorectal cancer.", "answer_choice": "B"}
